result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J. Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
cases #14CF35, #14CF101, #14CF215 called at 3:45pm. [MK]
Defendant Adam J. Patterson in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In response to the Court's inquiries, Mr. Patterson verifies that he is satisfied with Attorney Svehlek's representation, and wishes for her to continue as his counsel.
As to Case #14CF215 only:  Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest  " entered on Counts #1 and #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts pleas, finds Mr. Patterson guilty of Counts #1 & #3, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On agreement of the parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, #4, and #5. 
--------------------------------------------------------------
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.  Mr. Patterson makes a statement. 

In Case #14CF35, on Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Patterson to:
--serve 3 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes; to commence forthwith
--to pay costs of $243, plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge,  plus $200 DNA surcharge, plus $149.88 for officer overtime 
In Case #14CF35 on Count #5 the Court sentences Mr. Patterson to: 
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes; consecutive to Count #1 
--to pay costs of $243, plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge, plus $200 DNA surcharge
--71 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Patterson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.


----------------------------------------------------------------

In Case #14CF101 on Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Patterson to:
--serve 2 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes; consecutive to Case #14CF35
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--1 day credit for time already served given
--Mr. Patterson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

In Case #14CF215 on Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Patterson to:
--serve 2 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes; consecutive to Cases #14CF35 and #14CF101
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
In Case #14CF215 on Count #3 the Court sentences Mr. Patterson to: 
--serve one month in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes; consecutive to Cases #14CF35 and #14CF101 and to Count #1 of this case.
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge
--1 day credit for time already served given
--Mr. Patterson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

The Court indicates that if Mr. Patterson tests positive for alcohol or illegal drugs on any one of his jail sentences, then the resulting revocation of Huber privileges shall be as to all sentences in these cases that remain to be served.
The $500 cash bail amount in Case #14CF35 is to be applied, if it has not been forfeited or refunded to date.  The Court orders entry of civil judgments for the remaining unpaid court financial obligations in each case.
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given.  
Recess 4:24pm.
from Defendant regarding counsel
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
Status conference on December 9, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Scheduling Notice

cases #14CF35, #14CF101, #14CF215 called at 3:28pm. 
Defendant Adam J. Patterson in court, in custody.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court summarizes that it learned this morning that Attorney Buckett cannot appear with Mr. Patterson today because he is in a jury trial in Milwaukee County. 
On request of Mr. Patterson, the Court removes Attorney Buckett as PD counsel in these cases; the Public Defender is to appoint successor counsel. 
recess 3:35pm. 

NEXT:    (1) clerk is to copy these minutes to the PD Office with the request for appointment of successor counsel and that new counsel meet with Mr. Patterson in the Jail to prepare for the December 9th hearing   (2) schedule Cases #14CF35 and #14CF101 for Sentencing Hearing, and schedule Case #14CF215 for Status Conference, all on 12/9/14 at 3:30pm.

for continuance is granted

Cases 14CF35, 14CF101 & 14CF215 called at 1:51 pm
Defendant Adam J. Patterson in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews previous conflict review worksheet. Court finds that the finding made that there was no reason for recussal or disqualification remains the same.
Attorney De La Rosa advises that Attorney Buckett will continue to be the attorney of record on these files.
Court finds that the warrant s in all 3 files have been satisfied by the defendant's appearance, and should be removed from any database they were entered into.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,500.00 CASH bond to cover all 3 files, with all previous non-monetary conditions: 

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 1:57 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)

cases #14CF35, #14CF101, #14CF215 called at 1:49pm. 
Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases #14CF35 and #14CF101 are scheduled for Sentencing Hearing today, and Case #14CF215 is scheduled for Plea & Sentencing today, however Defendant Adam J. Patterson does not appear.
Attorney Buckett does not have information about why Mr. Patterson does not appear.
The Court orders issuance of a Bench Warrant- body only in each case. 
recess 1:50pm.

cases #14CF35, #14CF101, #14CF215 called at 2:45pm. 
Attorney Robert W. Buckett appears for the Defense.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Buckett indicates that he does not know why Defendant Adam J. Patterson does not appear.
The Court orders issuance of bench warrants in each case. 
recess 2:47pm.
[Post-Hearing/Off-Record, court staff learns that Mr. Patterson and his mother both left voicemail messages for Criminal Division clerks at 2:07pm, indicating that Mr. Patterson was going to be late because Mr. Patterson was at the doctors office. After the Court is informed of this, the Court indicates that it is quashing the warrants and the cases should be rescheduled (Sentencing in cases #14CF35 and #14CF101; Status in case #14CF215.]
Status conference on August 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Scheduling notice

Cases 14CF35, 14CF101 & 14CF215 called at 2:18 pm
Defendant Adam J. Patterson in court with Attorney Robert W. Buckett. ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF215:
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Patterson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Court and counsel discuss whether to set all files to be sentenced together.
Attorney Buckett requests that all files be set for sentencing together.
Attorney Bucket motions the Court to modify bond to allow for contact with Karen Patterson so he can move his belongings and her belongings into a storage unit.
ADA Hall does not take a postition on the motion for bond modification.

Court modifies the defendant's bond in case 14CF215 to allow the defendant to be present at 1021 Clement St. Apt. A. Watertown and contact with Karen and Christine Patterson every Saturday and Sunday begining 8/9/14 through 8/31/14 between the hours of 10:00 am and 6:00 pm. No violent conduct between the defendant and Karen & Christine Patterson.

recess: 2:39 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)

14CF35 & 14CF101- Sentencing: 8/22/14 at 2:30 pm
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 9, 2014 at 10:40 am.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF35 and #14CF101 and #14CF215 called at 2:32pm. 
Attorney Robert W Buckett in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases #14CF35 and #14CF101 were scheduled for Sentencing Hearing today, and Case #14CF215 was scheduled for Status Conference today, however Mr. Patterson has contacted court staff to say that the car of the person he was getting a ride from has broken down, and neither the transport person or Mr. Patterson have any funds to pay for any road service or repair.  
The Court expresses its inclination to issue bench warrants, however after a discussion with counsel on scheduling, instead, the Court grants the request of Attorney Buckett to schedule the cases as shown below.  However the Court indicates to Attorney Buckett that it will not put off sentencing on the two cases if a global settlement has not been reached at that point. 
recess 2:40pm. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/9/14 at 10:40am (2) reschedule Cases #14CF35 & #14CF101 for Sentencing, and set Case #14CF215 for Preliminary Hearing, all on same date/time during the first week in August

Status conference on June 30, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Probable Cause Statement

Case called at 1:16 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Adam J. Patterson appears in-custody, via video, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Patterson qualifies for SPD Representation
Service of Complaint admitted; Court confirms that address & DOB on complaint are accurate for Mr. Patterson; maximum penalties recited; reading waived 
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Flint indicates that 2nd page, 3rd pgh. 5th line "garbage" rather than "garage" - Court amends complaint by Its own hand.
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Counts #1 - #5

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No presence at 1021 Clement St. Apt. A, Watertown  
-No contact with Karen or Christine Patterson
-Appear at STC on 6/30/14 at 2:30 pm
Court reviews with Mr. Patterson that he needs to submit new address to COC within 48 hours of signing bond

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 
Recess: 1:31 pm 

NEXT: (1) COC rescan complaint (amended by Court) (2) Schedule STC 6/30/14 at 2:30 pm (along with Sentencing in cases 14CF35 & 14CF101) - Send notices
